question.text: Which of the following is a common feature of Ascidia, Pristis, Hyla and Calotes?

options.text: Skeleton made up of cartilage and bone
Solid, dorsal and double nerve cord
Three chambered heart with closed circulatory system
Paired pharyngeal gill slits at least in embryonic stage

solution.text: Ascidia is a urochordate with an open circulatory system and is a protochordate. Pristis is a cartilaginous sawfish and is jawed vertebrae bear fins. Hyla is a tree frog with a bony skeleton. Calotes is a garden lizard with bony skeleton all these animals bears the paired pharyngeal gill slits at least in the embryonic stage (chordates have the dorsal, hollow nerve cord).
